result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad E Shields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
08-27-15/ William W Brash
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to reflect a TOTAL of 169 days of sentence credit
Consecutive to: with 173 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment.
Be assessed for vocational needs, and if appropriate participate in programming.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

No contact with the victims as specified in the criminal complaint.
No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing.

Cooperate with agent.
Absolute sobriety, no drugs or alcohol.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer testing.
Referral to the mental health division for assessment, and treatment if deemed appropriate.
If prescribed medication, take all medications as prescribed, and in the manner specified by a treating doctor.
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad E Shields

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to Drug Abuse Correctional Center Attn. Stephanie P.O.Box36 Winnebago WI 54985

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.


IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.

In all other respects, the original judgment herein is affirmed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 28 Judge Sanders. os.
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Reflects 08-27-15 Court order for 169 total days of sentence credit
Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copy sent to Dodge Correctional and State.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. mag
DOC request to review sentence credit.
Original Transcript (41 pages) commencing 06/23/2015 PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS with 173 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-No contact with the victims as specified in the criminal complaint
-No new lasw violations reaching the level of a probable casue finding
-Cooperate with agent
-Absolute sobriety, no drugs or alcohol
-Random urine screens and breathalyzer testing
-No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing
-Referral to the mental health division for assessment, and treatment if deemed appropriate
-If prescribed medication, take all medications as prescribed, and in the manner specified by a treating doctor
-Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment
-Be assessed for vocational needs, and if appropriate participate in programming
-Provide a DNA sample


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, surcharges and assessments; 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment..

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Chad E Shields in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Chad E Shields in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski for Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Chad E Shields not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense not prepared to proceed on today; adjourned date selected with the parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Chad E Shields not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Chad E Shields not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense needs additional time to review discovery materials and offer; request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chad E Shields in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Chad E Shields in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Martha's Vineyard Store or it's employees; Baljit B.

Defendant Chad E Shields in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Chad E Shields in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Chad E Shields in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Chad E Shields in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.
